member.name: T:Fasterflect.Caching.CacheStrategy
member.summary: An enumeration of the supported caching strategies.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.Caching.CacheStrategy.None
member.summary: This value indicates that caching is disabled.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.Caching.CacheStrategy.Temporary
member.summary: This value indicates that caching is enabled, and that cached objects may be collected and released at will by the garbage collector. This is the default value.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.Caching.CacheStrategy.Permanent
member.summary: This value indicates that caching is enabled, and that cached objects may not be garbage collected. The developer must manually ensure that objects are removed from the cache when they are no longer needed.

member.summary: This value corresponds to the value.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.Flags.PartialNameMatch
member.summary: If this option is specified the search for a named member will perform a partial match instead of an exact match. If is specified the trimmed name is used instead of the original member name. If is specified the comparison uses and otherwise uses .

member.name: F:Fasterflect.Flags.TrimExplicitlyImplemented
member.summary: If this option is specified the search for a named member will strip off the namespace and interface name from explicitly implemented interface members before applying any comparison operations.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.Flags.ExcludeExplicitlyImplemented
member.summary: If this option is specified the search for members will exclude explicitly implemented interface members.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.Flags.ExcludeBackingMembers
member.summary: If this option is specified all members that are backers for another member, such as backing fields for automatic properties or get/set methods for properties, will be excluded from the result.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.Flags.IgnoreParameterModifiers
member.summary: If this option is specified the search for methods will avoid checking whether parameters have been declared as ref or out. This allows you to locate a method by its signature without supplying the exact details for every parameter.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.Flags.ExcludeHiddenMembers
member.summary: If this option is specified all members that are have either an override or are being shadowed/hidden (by another member declared using the new keyword) will be excluded from the result. This is implemented by simple name matching of members, ensuring that only the first member with a given name is included in the result. Note that this overlaps partially with the behavior of , however, an implementation that excludes members based on the presence of the new keyword does not seem to be possible and would in any case be much slower.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.Flags.AnyVisibility
member.summary: Search criteria encompassing all public and non-public members, including base members. Note that you also need to specify either the Instance or Static flag.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.Flags.InstancePublic
member.summary: Search criteria encompassing all public instance members, including base members.

member.summary: Search criteria encompassing all non-public instance members, including base members.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.FormatOptions.None
member.summary: This option specifies the empty set of options and does not affect the output.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.FormatOptions.AddHeader
member.summary: If this option is specified the generated XML will include an XML document header.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.FormatOptions.NewLineAfterElement
member.summary: If this option is specified a line feed will be emitted after every XML element.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.FormatOptions.Indent
member.summary: If this option is specified nested tags will be indented either 1 tab character (the default) or 4 space characters.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.FormatOptions.UseSpaces
member.summary: If this option is specified indentation will use spaces instead of tabs.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.FormatOptions.Default
member.summary: This option, which combines AddHeader, NewLineAfterElement and Indent, provides the default set of options used.

member.name: T:Fasterflect.Probing.MethodMap
member.summary: This class wraps a single invokable method call. It contains information on the method to call as well as the parameters to use in the method call. This intermediary class is used by the various other classes to select the best match to call from a given set of available methods/constructors (and a set of parameter names and types).

member.summary: Perform parameter reordering, null handling and type conversion in preparation of executing the method call.
member.param: The callers row of data.
member.returns: The parameter array to use in the actual invocation.

member.name: M:Fasterflect.Probing.MethodMap.AnySet(System.Collections.BitArray)
member.summary: Test whether at least one bit is set in the array. Replaces the old "long != 0" check.

member.name: M:Fasterflect.Probing.MethodMap.AllUnset(System.Collections.BitArray)
member.summary: Test whether no bits are set in the array. Replaces the old "long == 0" check.

member.name: M:Fasterflect.Probing.MethodMap.AllSet(System.Collections.BitArray)
member.summary: Test whether no bits are set in the array. Replaces the old "long == 0" check.

member.name: M:Fasterflect.TryCallMethodExtensions.TryCallMethod(System.Object,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Object)
member.summary: Obtains a list of all methods with the given on the given , and invokes the best match for the parameters obtained from the public properties of the supplied object. TryCallMethod is very liberal and attempts to convert values that are not otherwise considered compatible, such as between strings and enums or numbers, Guids and byte[16], etc.
member.returns: The result of the invocation.

TryCallMethod is very liberal and attempts to convert values that are not otherwise considered compatible, such as between strings and enums or numbers, Guids and byte[16], etc.
member.returns: The result of the invocation.

member.summary: Obtains a list of all methods with the given on the given , and invokes the best match for the supplied parameters. TryCallMethod is very liberal and attempts to convert values that are not otherwise considered compatible, such as between strings and enums or numbers, Guids and byte[16], etc.
member.param: The type of which an instance should be created.
The name of the overloaded methods.
Specifies whether all supplied parameters must be used in the invocation. Unless you know what you are doing you should pass true for this parameter.

The types of the supplied parameters.
The values of the supplied parameters.
member.returns: The result of the invocation.

member.name: T:Fasterflect.TryCreateInstanceExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for creating object instances when you do not know which constructor to call.

member.name: F:Fasterflect.TryCreateInstanceExtensions.sourceInfoCache
member.summary: This field is used to cache information on objects used as parameters for object construction, which improves performance for subsequent instantiations of the same type using a compatible source type.

member.name: M:Fasterflect.TryCreateInstanceExtensions.TryCreateInstance(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the given using the public properties of the supplied object as input. This method will try to determine the least-cost route to constructing the instance, which implies mapping as many properties as possible to constructor parameters. Remaining properties on the source are mapped to properties on the created instance or ignored if none matches. TryCreateInstance is very liberal and attempts to convert values that are not otherwise considered compatible, such as between strings and enums or numbers, Guids and byte[], etc.
member.returns: An instance of .

member.name: M:Fasterflect.TryCreateInstanceExtensions.TryCreateInstance(System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Creates an instance of the given using the values in the supplied dictionary as input. This method will try to determine the least-cost route to constructing the instance, which implies mapping as many values as possible to constructor parameters. Remaining values are mapped to properties on the created instance or ignored if none matches. TryCreateInstance is very liberal and attempts to convert values that are not otherwise considered compatible, such as between strings and enums or numbers, Guids and byte[], etc.
member.returns: An instance of .

member.name: M:Fasterflect.TryCreateInstanceExtensions.TryCreateInstance(System.Type,System.String[],System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of the given using the supplied parameter information as input. Parameter types are inferred from the supplied and as such these should not be null. This method will try to determine the least-cost route to constructing the instance, which implies mapping as many properties as possible to constructor parameters. Remaining properties on the source are mapped to properties on the created instance or ignored if none matches. TryCreateInstance is very liberal and attempts to convert values that are not otherwise considered compatible, such as between strings and enums or numbers, Guids and byte[], etc.
member.param: The type of which an instance should be created.
The names of the supplied parameters.
The values of the supplied parameters.
member.returns: An instance of .

member.name: M:Fasterflect.TryInvokeWithValuesExtensions.TryCall(Fasterflect.ParameterConverter,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Reflection.MethodBase},System.Object,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Implementation details:
Matching process is done on a shallow copy of parametersValues so that the converter could "modify" elements at will.
There will be a problem if the converter modifies a child array and the method ends up not being matched (because of another parameter).
The standard Fasterflect converter doesn't modify child array so it's safe. This is only problematic when a custom converter is provided.
TODO How to fix it? a deep clone?
